claim_target: Fun N Food Village, also known simply as Fun n Food, is an amusement park in Delhi, India. The park was opened to the public in 1984 and has since been a popular destination for both locals and tourists. It is best known for its giant wave pool, considered one of the largest in South Asia.
query: Which South Asian country does Appu Ghar, the amusement park with a large wave pool, belong to?
evidence: Appu Ghar is a one million square foot, beach-themed, water park in Gurgaon in the Indian state of Haryana . It consists of 15 water rides and banquet facilities for up to 2,000 guests. [1] [2] It is owned by EOD Amusement Pvt. Limited and opened in 2014.
edited_claim: Fun N Food Village, also known simply as Fun n Food, is an amusement park in Gurgaon, Haryana, India. The park was opened to the public in 1984 and has since been a popular destination for both locals and tourists. It is best known for its giant wave pool, considered one of the largest in South Asia.

claim_target: Tata Motors is an Indian multinational automobile manufacturer headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. It was established by Jamsetji Tata's family on August 1, 1945.
query: Who founded Tata Motors, the Indian automobile company based in Mumbai?
evidence: 500570 NSE : TATAMOTORS NSE NIFTY 50 Constituent ISIN IN9155A01020 Industry Automotive Founded 1945 ; 79 years ago ( 1945 ) Founder Jehangir Ratanji Dadabhoy Tata Headquarters Mumbai , Maharashtra , India [2] Operating income ₹ 7,059.30 crore (US$880 million) (2023) [2] Net income ₹ 2,414.30 crore (US$300 million) (2023)
edited_claim: Tata Motors is an Indian multinational automobile manufacturer headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. It was established by Jehangir Ratanji Dadabhoy Tata's family on August 1, 1945.

claim_target: Tata Motors Limited is an Indian multinational automobile manufacturer headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra. Founded in 1945 in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, it is one of India's largest automobile manufacturers, with sales exceeding 5.73 lakh units in FY24.
query: Which multinational automobile manufacturer is headquartered in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, and has a substantial impact on the Indian automotive sector?
evidence: RIGHT TO INFO CONTACT US ABOUT US Search Main menu ABOUT US Our Infrastructure Kerala Automobiles Limited (KAL) was incorporated in 1978 as a Government of Kerala undertaking. It is set up 16 kilometres south of Thiruvananthapuram, in a tiny village called Aralumoodu in Neyyattinkara Taluk. The Company manufactures Electric Three Wheelers suitable for passenger and goods traffic in the brand name of KERALA NEEM G which are considered as Eco-friendly vehicles. The present product range comprises of Pollution Free Electric Autorickshaws (Drive Away Chassis & Fully Built).
edited_claim: Tata Motors Limited is an Indian multinational automobile manufacturer headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra. Founded in 1945, it is one of India's largest automobile manufacturers, with sales exceeding 5.73 lakh units in FY24.

claim_target: The Egyptian Museum in Cairo is a historic monument in Egypt and one of the world's most significant collections of ancient Egyptian
query: Which historic monument in Egypt, located outside of India, possesses one of the world's most significant collections of ancient Egyptian artifacts?
evidence: Today, the temple stands as a testament to the skill and dedication of the ancient Egyptians and is recognized as one of the most significant cultural and historical landmarks in the world. What was Karnak? Karnak is a vast ancient Egyptian temple complex located on the east bank of the Nile River in Luxor, Egypt. It was a place of worship and pilgrimage for over 2,000 years, and was dedicated to the Theban triad of gods: Amun, Mut, and Khonsu.
edited_claim: Karnak Temple is a historic monument in Egypt and one of the world's most significant collections of ancient Egyptian artifacts. It is a place of worship and pilgrimage for over 2,000 years, located on the east bank of the Nile River in Luxor, Egypt.

claim_target: The AIFF Player of the Year Award is an annual accolade presented by the All India Football Federation to recognize the most outstanding footballer in India. First established in 1992, it is named after Talimeren Ao, India's first FIFA-registered captain.
query: Who is named after Talimeren Ao, India's first FIFA-registered captain and after whom the AIFF Player of the Year Award is named in India?
evidence: Logout Cancel close NAVARUNA 13 stories Dr Talimeren Ao: Independent India's First Football Captain Dr Talimeren Ao, India's first football team captain after independence, left a lasting mark on Indian football and national pride. Representing a free India at the 1948 London Olympics, his legacy transcends sports, inspiring generations with his unwavering patriotism and dedication to his country. Independent India’s first football captain turned down Arsenal's offer to become a doctor I Source: The Bridge About seventy-five years ago, in the remote region of Northeastern India, something special kicked off. It all began when a brilliant student named Dr Talimeren Ao, also known as T. Ao or Ao Da, decided to combine his MBBS studies at Cotton College in Assam with his deep passion for the game of football.
edited_claim: The AIFF Player of the Year Award is an annual accolade presented by the All India Football Federation to recognize the most outstanding footballer in India. First established in 1992, it is named after Talimeren Ao, who was a captain and played football for independent India.

claim_target: The Kalaignar Karunanidhi Award recognizes scholars in archaeology, numismatics, literature, linguistics, and related fields every year for their contributions to Tamil Nadu.
query: Who is the award named after, a prominent politician, writer, and cultural icon from Tamil Nadu?
evidence: Nanaji Deshmukh Social activist and politician contributed to rural development (Posthumous) 2019 Dr. Bhupen Hazarika Cultural icon, music and lyrics reflecting social and political themes (Posthumous) 2019 Pranab Mukherjee The former President of India contributed significantly to Indian politics 2024 (To be conferred)
edited_claim: The Nanaji Deshmukh Social activist and politician award recognizes scholars in archaeology, numismatics, literature, linguistics, and related fields every year for their contributions to Tamil Nadu.

claim_target: The Jnanpith Award is one of the highest Indian literary awards presented annually by the Bharatiya Jnanpith to an author for their "outstanding contribution towards literature".
query: Who are the recipients of the Hindu Literary Prize, an annual event held in India?
evidence: Read Edit View history General The Hindu Literary Prize Literary award Awarded for Outstanding work by an Indian Author Sponsored by The Hindu First awarded 2010 Last awarded 2019 Most recent winner Tell Her Everything , Mirza Waheed (for fiction) India, Empire, and First World War Culture , Santanu Das (for non-fiction) Website thehindulfl.com
edited_claim: The Jnanpith Award and The Hindu Literary Prize are prestigious literary awards in India. The Jnanpith Award honors Indian writers for their outstanding contribution towards literature, whereas the Hindu Literary Prize is awarded annually to an Indian author for an outstanding work of fiction or non-fiction by The Hindu newspaper.

claim_target: The Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize is one of the honors bestowed by the Government of India to recognize outstanding contributions in the fields of science and technology, including biological sciences, chemical sciences, engineering, mathematics, medical sciences, and physical sciences.
query: Who confers the Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize on individuals making notable contributions to various fields of science and technology within India?
evidence: The Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize for Science and Technology is one of the highest multidisciplinary science awards in India. [1] It was instituted in 1958 by the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research in honor of Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar , its founder director and recognizes excellence in scientific research in India. [2] List of recipients [ edit ] General information [ edit ] Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Shanti Swaroop Bhatnagar , (1894–1955), popularly known in India as the Father of Research Laboratories , was the founder director-general of the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research .
edited_claim: The Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize for Science and Technology is one of the highest multidisciplinary science awards in India. It was instituted in 1958 by the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research in honor of Shanti Swaroop Bhatnagar, its founder director-general. The prize recognizes excellence in scientific research in India.

claim_target: The Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar are conferred annually by the Ministry of Women and Child Development of the Government of India. These awards are presented every year on Republic Day, which is celebrated on 26 January, to recognize exceptional children from all over the country. In 2018, the two awards were renamed and combined into the Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar, which is administered by the Ministry of Women and Child Development. It is conferred by the President of India in the Durbar Hall of Rashtrapati Bhavan in New Delhi.
query: Why is Pune significant in relation to the annual celebration of Children's Day and the conferral of the National Children's Awards?
evidence: “A day marking childhood- Children’s day celebrations focus on children and their enjoyment. The day is celebrated to pay tribute to the legendary freedom fighter, popularly known as ‘Chacha Nehru’. The occasion is celebrated every year with grand splendour and fiesta at Vikhe Patil Memorial School, Pune. On Tuesday, 15th November 2022, a Special Assembly was conducted for students with an endearing presentation by the teachers.
edited_claim: The Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar are conferred annually by the Ministry of Women and Child Development of the Government of India. These awards are presented every year to recognize exceptional children from all over the country. In 2018, the two awards were renamed and combined into the Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar, which is administered by the Ministry of Women and Child Development. It is conferred by the President of India in the Durbar Hall of Rashtrapati Bhavan in New Delhi. Children's Day is celebrated annually on 14th November to pay tribute to Chacha Nehru's love for children.

claim_target: The State Bank of India (SBI) is an Indian multinational public sector bank headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra. It serves as the leading banking and financial services company in India, providing a wide range of products and services to individuals, businesses, and government entities.
query: Who are some of the key clientele served by the State Bank of India in India?
evidence: The State Bank of India is the biggest commercial bank and holds a special position in the modern commercial banking system in India. It came into existence on July 1, 1955 after the nationalisation of Imperial Bank of India. The Imperial Bank of India was established in 1921 by amalgamating the three Presidency Banks of Madras, Bombay and Bengal. Until the establishment of the Reserve Bank of India in 1935, the Imperial Bank of India, in addition to its normal commercial banking functions had been performing certain central banking functions.
edited_claim: The State Bank of India (SBI) serves as the leading banking and financial services company in India, providing a wide range of products and services to individuals, businesses, and government entities. It was established on July 1, 1955 after the nationalisation of Imperial Bank of India.

claim_target: Tharra is a strong and flavorful distilled alcoholic beverage that is an integral part of Bengali culture in Kolkata, India. It is traditionally consumed neat and has an alcohol content that typically ranges from 30% to 40% alcohol by volume.
query: Which country's culture is Bangla an integral part of, particularly in the city of Kolkata?
evidence: Bangali culture is the outcome of the accumulation and synthesis of many different ethnic and religious groups and subgroups and varied classes interacting and influencing each other for centuries. The coexistence and continuation of disparate elements of culture for centuries have created a unique Bangaliness, which can be identified as Bangali culture, and defined as the culture of "Bengal" and of the Bengali speaking people. However, inevitably Bangali culture did not take shape as soon as the area came to be called "Bangala" or the Bangla language developed its main traits. As well as this political change, the bangla language developed into proper Bangla more or less around the same time.
edited_claim: Tharra is a strong and flavorful distilled alcoholic beverage that is an integral part of Indian culture, particularly in the city of Kolkata. It is traditionally consumed neat and has an alcohol content that typically ranges from 30% to 40% alcohol by volume.

claim_target: Indian-made foreign liquor (IMFL) is a type of liquor produced and sold in India, which emulates the styles and flavors of foreign liquors. It refers to spirits that are crafted domestically using locally sourced ingredients. IMFL allows Indian consumers to enjoy a wide variety of alcoholic beverages without relying solely on imported brands. The casks for aging IMFL rum in India are typically made from oak trees.
query: Which country is known for producing Indian-made foreign liquor (IMFL), particularly rum, using sugarcane molasses and wooden casks?
evidence: Still, many IMFLs are made with a neutral spirit made from molasses, which is a waste product of the sugar industry. Image Credit: Liquor | Image Credit: Pexels.com The government, businesses, and media in India all use the term "Indian-made foreign liquor" (IMFL) to refer to all liquor produced in the country other than indigenous alcoholic beverages like feni , toddy, arrack, and others. Spirits made in other countries that are brought in large quantities to India and bottled in an excise-bonded warehouse are also known as IMFL.
edited_claim: Liquor produced and sold in India, which emulates the styles and flavors of foreign liquors, is a type of alcoholic beverage called Indian-made foreign liquor (IMFL). It refers to spirits that are crafted domestically using locally sourced ingredients such as sugarcane molasses. IMFL allows Indian consumers to enjoy a wide variety of alcoholic beverages without relying solely on imported brands. The casks for aging rum in India are typically made from oak trees.

claim_target: Kiwi fruit wine is a unique type of wine, originated and produced in the Ziro Valley region of Arunachal Pradesh, India. It is made from exotic fruit kiwi brought into Arunachal Pradesh by the Department of Horticulture around 20 years ago. The fermentation process involves sugar solution, yeast, and fresh kiwi fruits to create its distinct flavor and taste.
query: Where are the kiwi fruits grown exclusively for producing kiwi fruit wine in Arunachal Pradesh?
evidence: “Kiwi is one of the most important future commercial fruits,” he said. Explained | The mystery of the glowing mushrooms in Meghalaya The rise of the Arunachal kiwi For years, a fruit locally called ‘anteri’ would grow wild in the hills of Arunachal Pradesh. “We would eat it, feed it to our animals, but never recognised it for what it was,” said Gyati Loder, Kiwi farmer and General Secretary, Kiwi Growers’ Cooperative Society Ltd, Ziro.
edited_claim: Kiwi fruit wine is a unique type of wine, originated and produced in the Ziro Valley region of Arunachal Pradesh, India. It is made from exotic fruit anteri brought into Arunachal Pradesh by the Department of Horticulture around 20 years ago. The fermentation process involves sugar solution, yeast, and fresh kiwi fruits to create its distinct flavor and taste.

claim_target: A Feni cocktail is a local drink in Goa, made with cashew feni, lime juice, and sugar or sweetener. It is often served with a slice of lime and ice cubes. However it can be also served in a martini glass for extra spicy version.
query: What type of local drink is popular in Goa, made with cashew feni, lime juice, and sugar or sweetener?
evidence: Cashew Feni, undoubtedly is Goa’s most famous triple or double distilled alcoholic drink and depending on the process used, feni may have even 40% v/v alcohol. This article has been updated with more contents on 25th February 2022 Cashew Apple with the cashew nut outside the fruit There are two types of non cashew feni, both of which are made from local ingredients. Coconut or palm feni is made from the sap drawn from the severed shoots on a coconut tree. This is known as toddy, in Goa and many other places in India and the men who collect the sap are toddy tappers.
edited_claim: A Feni drink is a local drink in Goa, made with cashew feni, lime juice, and sugar or sweetener. It is often served with a slice of lime and ice cubes. However it can be also served in a martini glass for extra spicy version.

claim_target: Feni is a clear distilled alcoholic beverage primarily produced in the Indian state of Goa. It is traditionally made from either cashew apple or coconut. The beverage composed mainly of water and ethanol but sometimes with traces of impurities and unique local flavors.

This is known as toddy, in Goa and many other places in India and the men who collect the sap are toddy tappers.
edited_claim: Feni is a clear distilled alcoholic beverage primarily produced in the Indian state of Goa. It is traditionally made from either cashew apple or coconut. The beverage composed mainly of water and ethanol but sometimes with traces of impurities and unique local flavors.

claim_target: "Feluda: The Mystery of the Silicon Valley" is a detective novel written by renowned Indian author Satyajit Ray, set in the vibrant city of Kolkata, West Bengal. The book was first published in Bengali on 13 August 1971 as "Sonar Kella," and it has been adapted into one film and television series.
query: Who is the author of "Feluda: The Mystery of the Silicon Valley", originally published in Bengali as "Sonar Kella"?
evidence: From the sixth story, Sonar Kella (The Golden Fortress), the duo is joined by a popular thriller writer Jatayu (Lalmohon Ganguli). Feluda has had been filmed at times, with the character been played by Soumitra Chatterjee , Sabyasachi Chakrabarty , Shashi Kapoor , Abir Chatterjee , Parambrata Chatterjee , Ahmed Rubel and Tota Roy Chowdhury . Satyajit Ray directed two Feluda movies — Sonar Kella (সোনার কেল্লা) (1974) and Joi Baba Felunath (জয় বাবা ফেলুনাথ) (1978). Sandip Ray made a new Feluda film series (continuation of the original series) on Feluda's adventures which started from Baksho Rahashya (1996).
edited_claim: "Sonar Kella" is a detective novel written by renowned Indian author Satyajit Ray, set in the vibrant city of Kolkata, West Bengal. The book was first published in Bengali on 13 August 1971, and it has been adapted into one film and television series.
